edu.rit.gpu.example

Class WV

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.Struct
      • edu.rit.gpu.example.WV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class WV
extends Struct
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Class WV encapsulates the weight and value of an item in a knapsack problem. It is also used to hold the total weight and total value of all the items in the knapsack. It is the Java version of the CUDA wv_t structure in files KnapsackExhGpu.cu and WalkSackGpu.cu. Class WV can be used to mirror weight/value objects between the CPU and the GPU.

      • isBetterThan

        public boolean isBetterThan(WV wv,
                   long C)
        Determine if this weight/value object is better than the given weight/value object with respect to the given capacity.
        Parameters:
        wv - Weight/value object to compare with.
        C - Knapsack capacity.
        Returns:
        True if this weight/value object is better than wv, false otherwise.

      • sizeof

        public static long sizeof()
        Returns the size in bytes of the C struct. The size must include any internal padding bytes needed to align the fields of the C struct. The size must include any padding bytes at the end needed to align a series of C structs in an array.
        Returns:
        Size of C struct (bytes).

      • toStruct

        public void toStruct(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Write this Java object to the given byte buffer in the form of a C struct. The byte buffer's byte order is little endian. The byte buffer is positioned at the first byte of the C struct. The toStruct() method must write this object's fields into the byte buffer exactly as the C struct is laid out in GPU memory.
        Specified by:
        toStruct in class Struct
        Parameters:
        buf - Byte buffer to write.

The fromStruct() method must read this object's fields from the byte buffer exactly as the C struct is laid out in GPU memory.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
